esp:page.esp:name: Nammu and Emacs
esp:page.esp:title: Using Nammu and Emacs for Oracc work

body.p: Nammu is a simple text editor, written especially for Oracc by UCL's Research Development Software Group, that enables all content creators to edit ATF files, one file at at time. Use Nammu if your main role in Oracc is to edit texts for a corpus project. Emacs is a high-powered text editor which, while not particularly pretty, is extremely useful for editing multiple ATF files at once, managing glossaries projects, and writing ESP portals. For now, use Emacs for activities that involve these tasks. In due course Nammu will gradually replace all of Emacs functionality.

dl.dd: Here we describe how to install and set up Nammu, and how to edit ATF files with it.
On this page we describe how to obtain, install and configure it for Oracc work.
